what: Fit Linearized Hyperbolic Model for Delay Discounting Curves
title: Fit Linearized Hyperbolic Model for Delay Discounting Curves
text: goal delaydiscount package provide methods analyzing delay discounting data using linearized hyperbolic model.

title: Fit Linearized Hyperbolic Model for Delay Discounting Curves
text: can install development version delaydiscount Github.

title: Fit Linearized Hyperbolic Model for Delay Discounting Curves
text: fit model dataset delay discounting data, first run prepare_data_frame dataset, run dd_hyperbolic_model output.
code: library(delaydiscount) ## basic example of fitting a model prep_remedi <- prepare_data_frame(remedi) fit <- dd_hyperbolic_model(prep_remedi) fit$ln_k_mean #>     condition ln_k_mean   std_err #> EFT       EFT -6.877057 0.1638994 #> HIT       HIT -5.860534 0.1506689 #> NCC       NCC -6.078229 0.1369001 fit$var #>  sigma_sq         g  #>  1.978107 10.407330

what: This function gets model parameter estimates for each group, including hyperparameters and estimates of the variance components (the observation error and subject random effect). It also gets F-test results for pairwise equality for the hyperparameter for each pair of groups, and overall equality of all hyperparameters. — dd_hyperbolic_model
title: This function gets model parameter estimates for each group, including hyperparameters and estimates of the variance components (the observation error and subject random effect). It also gets F-test results for pairwise equality for the hyperparameter for each pair of groups, and overall equality of all hyperparameters. — dd_hyperbolic_model
text: function gets model parameter estimates group, including hyperparameters estimates variance components (observation error subject random effect). also gets F-test results pairwise equality hyperparameter pair groups, overall equality hyperparameters.

title: This function gets model parameter estimates for each group, including hyperparameters and estimates of the variance components (the observation error and subject random effect). It also gets F-test results for pairwise equality for the hyperparameter for each pair of groups, and overall equality of all hyperparameters. — dd_hyperbolic_model
text: list objects ln_k_mean data frame estimates hyperparameters group along standard error estimate. hyperparameter group can interpreted mean ln(k) subject group. var vector entries sigma_sq g sigma_sq variance observed transformed indifference conditioned true ln(k) subject g related variance subject random effect, equal g*sigma_sq/T, T number time points.

Estimate the hyperparameters for each group, as well as the variance components of the model, using maximum likelihood estimation. — estimate_hyperbolic_model_params
text: dd_data specially formatted data frame returned prepare_data_frame function.

title: Estimate the hyperparameters for each group, as well as the variance components of the model, using maximum likelihood estimation. — estimate_hyperbolic_model_params
text: list two objects ln_k_mean data frame estimates hyperparameters group along standard error estimate. hyperparameter group can interpreted mean ln(k) subject group. var vector entries sigma_sq g sigma_sq variance observed transformed indifference conditioned true ln(k) subject g related variance subject random effect, equal g*sigma_sq/T, T number time points. pairwise_f_tests data frame containing results pairwise f-tests equality hyperparameters. columns col1 col2 contain groups pairwise F-test. F_stat column contains F-statistic, p_value column contains p-value, df1 df2 columns contain numerator denominator degrees freedom, respectively. model_test data frame containing result F-test equality hyperparameters. contains columns F_stat, p_value, df1, df2, meaning pairwise_f_tests data frame.

what: Apply rule checks to each subject. — jb_rule_check

text: rules : must one pair consecutive time points indifference point increases 0.2 indifference point must decrease least 0.1 earliest latest time point.

title: Apply rule checks to each subject. — jb_rule_check
Apply rule checks to each subject. — jb_rule_check
text: dd_data data frame containing discounting data long format. (describe preconditions input?) data long format, columns identifying subject, group time point observation, indifference point. variables named subj, group, delay, indiff, respectively. Values indifference points 0 1, exclusive. delays positive. subjects observations exact set delays.

title: Apply rule checks to each subject. — jb_rule_check
text: data frame consisting one observation per subject within group boolean variables C1 C2 TRUE corresponding rule passed FALSE .
